str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A foreigner, one who speaks neither Greek nor Latin; as adj: foreign. Of uncertain derivation; a foreigner.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From para and echo; to hold near, i.e. Present, afford, exhibit, furnish occasion.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: (a) gen: I obtain, (b) absol: I chance, happen; ordinary, everyday, it may chance, perhaps.
Love of mankind, benevolence. From the same as philanthropos; fondness of mankind, i.e. Benevolence.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To kindle, light. A primary verb; properly, to fasten to, i.e. to set on fire.
A fire, pile of burning fuel. From pur; a fire.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I take to myself, (b) I take aside, (c) I welcome. From pros and lambano; to take to oneself, i.e. Use, lead, admit.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Rain. From a primary huo; rain, especially a shower.
